summary: Book Review #79 of 2018:
title: Book Review #79 of 2018:
body:
Kingdom of Ash by Sarah J. Maas. Rating: 5 Stars.

Read from November 1 to November 4.

I’m going to start by saying that this review will come nowhere near the love I have for this book. It’ll be messy and gross because that’s how I get when I just finished a book that *destroyed* me.

I was afraid going into this book that one of two things would happen: 1) I wouldn’t love this world anymore after this book or 2) the author would be too afraid to “kill your darlings” to give the readers the ending they deserve. It’s been an issue in a lot of Y.A. within the past few years, or at least so I’ve noticed, where authors build up to a moment for several books and then refuse to do the thing they built up to. And it would have been very easy for an author who has spent thousands of pages with her characters to decide not to hurt them or not to kill them when it came to the end of the story. But I think Maas very wisely chose to give us the ending that the readers deserved. Did it hurt? Did I cry? Did I wish these poor, precious loves of mine didn’t have to go through this? Yes. Yes. Yes. But I went through out the entire book worrying for these characters, loving these characters, wanting the best for them. And at no point did I assume everything would just wrap up in a neat little bow.

I loved seeing all of the different armies coming together to try to defeat Erawan and Maeve. When we first enter Adarlan in book one, the world is so small and we don’t get to glimpse what’s outside of it.  I think it was something lacking in the first few books and so I was glad to see it here.

Here are some texts I sent to a reader friend as an example of how absolutely wrecked this book made me:

Me: This damn book.
L: Oh no.
Me: Oh, don’t worry. I’m only 25% of the way through the book. It *could* be a lot better later. Or worse.

Me: Oh my god. Sarah J. Maas needs to fucking stop. How much of this are we supposed to take?
L: Like 60% more?
Me: I still have closer to 67% left.

Me: Ugh. I can’t get over this damn fucking book. Goddamn it.

Me: Fuck chapter 96. Okay, let’s just assume the rest of this book is going to break me.
L: Good to know.

summary: Kingdom of Ash. (Spoiler)
body:
Kingdom of Ash. (Spoiler)

Las llamas resplandecientes se encogieron, el vapor onduló al pasar. Hasta que no hubo más que una delgada columna de fuego, velada en la llanura envuelta en niebla. No un pilar de fuego. Pero Aelin. Brillante blanco-caliente. Como si se hubiera entregado tan completamente a la llama que ella misma se había convertido en fuego.

La Portadora de Fuego, alguien susurró en las almenas.

La niebla onduló y se hinchó, convirtiéndola en nada más que una esfinge resplandeciente. El silencio se volvió reverente. Un suave viento del norte barrió. El velo de niebla se retiró, y allí estaba ella. Ella brillaba desde dentro. Brillaba dorado, con los zarcillos de su cabello flotando en un viento fantasma.

“El heredero de Mala”, respiró Yrene.

Kingdom of Ash, Sarah J. Maas

summary: I can just imagine Cassian doing this:
body:
I can just imagine Cassian doing this:

Everytime one of the Inner Circle says something he just rolls his eyes and goes ”Cassi-and?”

Just imagine:

*in the middle of a war council*

Rhys: The enemy has thousands of soldiers… and who knows what horrors aswell

Cassian: Cassi-and?

*responding to anything that Nesta says*

Cassian: Cassi-and?

*at the House of Wind*

Feyre: me and Rhysand are having a baby

Cassian: Cassi-and? Wait what? I get to be an uncle? I GET TO BE AN UNCLE!!! Can you name him Cassian?

Feyre: No

Cassian: Cass me outside

summary:
Mor: Rhys entertain me i’m bored
Rhys: Fine okay, I’ll tell you about the time I met a beautiful woman- I think she is my...
body:
Mor: Rhys entertain me i’m bored

Rhys: Fine okay, I’ll tell you about the time I met a beautiful woman- I think she is my mate

Mor: yeah right, now I’m entertained *starts hysterically laughing*

*Cassian enters*

Cassian: Mor, why are you howling?

Mor: Rhysand says that he thinks he’s found his mate

Cassian: *starts laughing* As if, omg

*Cassian and Mor leave*

Rhysand: *looks at the screen like in the office*

tags: a court of thorns and roses
summary: Hi! I'm new to sarah j maas's books and just finished the acotar series. I was wondering if the other series are in the same...
question: Hi! I'm new to sarah j maas's books and just finished the acotar series. I was wondering if the other series are in the same world as the acotar? I hope this question makes sense lol 😅
answer:
Hi!

So, the ACOTAR world includes:

The ACOTAR Trilogy  (ACOTAR, ACOMAF, and ACOWAR)

A Court of Frost and Starlight, the novella

and Sarah J. Maas will be writing a new spin-off in the world, but unfortunately, it hasn’t come out yet😭


She also has the Throne of Glass series (Beginning with the novel Throne of Glass and it has seven books plus a novella bind-up) but it doesn’t take place in the same world. The worlds of extremely similar (still dealing with Fae, mates, magic, and other creatures), and there's a tiny tiny tiny connection to the worlds that is revealed in the final TOG book.


I hope that helped!!!

summary: I've started to read kingdom of ash three times but I can't get past chapter 1. I don't want it to end but I do want to see how...
body: I’ve started to read kingdom of ash three times but I can’t get past chapter 1. I don’t want it to end but I do want to see how it ends 😭

summary: SJM booksleeves/book beau/book snuggies?
title: SJM booksleeves/book beau/book snuggies?
body:
Do y’all know of anyone anywhere who has SJM booksleeves for sale? (The padded ones that protect your book when you put it in your bag.) 

Hit me with your recommendations!! TOG or ACOTAR. Honestly my ideal here is one that just says “I ❤ Lorcan” but I’m flexible ;)
